tooltip.agile: Grant dex to damage for attacks.
tooltip.alignment: Activates bonuses when targeting tokens with the chosen alignment.
tooltip.all: Bonuses will be active for any action that can accept the bonus.
tooltip.crit: Modify the crit range and/or multiplier.
tooltip.crit-mult: Increase or Decrease the critical multiplier.
tooltip.crit-offset: Modify the critical threat range. This modification happens after Keen.
tooltip.damage-type: Bonuses will be applied to actions that deal the chosen damage type
tooltip.dc: Modify the DC for spells and abilities.
tooltip.effective-size: Formula input for increasing a sizeRoll formula's Effective Size. This is used for buffs like Lead Blades, Gravity Bow, etc.
tooltip.finesse-bonus: Use dex for attack rolls instead of strength.
tooltip.finesse-target: Bonuses will be active for all finesse-able targets. This requires the weapon/attack to have the Finesse weapon property, be in the Natural Attack weapon group, or have the `finesse-override` boolean flag.
tooltip.fortune: Roll twice and take the better. Multiple bonuses stack.
tooltip.function: A custom function that's executed to determine what to target. See examples in documentation.
tooltip.function-player-label: Label shown to players when configured. Players will not be able to edit the function.
tooltip.furious-focus: Negate the attack penalty of power attack on the first attack made each round.
tooltip.is-melee: Bonuses will be active whenever a melee attack action is used.
tooltip.is-ranged: Bonuses will be active whenever a ranged attack action is used.
tooltip.is-spell: Bonuses will be active whenever a spell attack action is used.
tooltip.is-weapon: Bonuses will be active whenever a physical weapon attack action is used.
tooltip.item: Bonuses will be applied when using these specific Items.
tooltip.misfortune: Roll twice and take the worse. Multiple bonuses stack.
tooltip.self: Applies bonuses to all actions on this same Item.
tooltip.spell-school: Bonuses will applied to spells of the chosen school(s).
tooltip.spell: Apply bonuses for actions for these specific spells.
tooltip.token: Apply bonuses for actions while specific tokens are targeted. When this buff is activated, a dialog will show up that allows you to choose from tokens in the scene.
tooltip.weapon-group: Apply bonuses when using weapons from chosen Weapon Group(s). Attacks and Weapons must be properly configured with weapon groups.
tooltip.weapon-type: Apply bonuses when using the chosen Weapon. Attacks and Weapons must be properly configured with Equipment Base Types.
tooltip.weapon: Choose specific Attacks and Weapons for bonuses.

versatilePerformance.skillTip: Can be used with Versatile Performance - {base} ({enabled})
versatilePerformance.title: Versatile Performance - {skill}

armor-focus.name: Armor Focus
armor-focus.hint: The name of the 'Armor Focus' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

debug.name: Debug Mode
debug.hint: Enable this to turn on extra logging which may help in tracking down certain issues. Defaults to `false`.

elementalFocus.name: Elemental Focus
elementalFocus.hint: The name of the 'Elemental Focus' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

extreme-mood-swings.name: Extreme Mood Swings
extreme-mood-swings.hint: The name of the 'Extreme Mood Swings' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

fortuneStacks.name: Fortune Stacks
fortuneStacks.hint: If true (default), multiple fortunes/misfortunes from different sources will stack. So you could potentially end up with 4d20kh. If false, then multiple fortunes/misfortunes will only go to a max of two dice. Multiple misfortune and fortunes affecting the same roll will cancel out (e.g. 3 differnt fortunes vs 2 different misfortunes means you are "more fortunate" and will be rolling with a bonus. If you have an equal number of fortune vs misfortune, then you "break even" and roll normally.)

furious-focus.name: Furious Focus
furious-focus.hint: The name of the feat 'Furious Focus'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

greaterElementalFocus.name: Greater Elemental Focus
greaterElementalFocus.hint: The 'Greater' adjective, feat names are checked for this plus 'Elemental Focus'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

greaterSpellFocus.name: Greater Spell Focus
greaterSpellFocus.hint: The 'Greater' adjective, feat names are checked for this plus 'Spell Focus'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

greater-weapon-focus.name: Greater Weapon Focus
greater-weapon-focus.hint: The 'Greater' adjective, feat names are checked for this plus 'Weapon Focus'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

greater-weapon-specialization.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
greater-weapon-specialization.hint: The 'Greater' adjective, feat names are checked for this plus 'Weapon Specialization'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

improved-armor-focus.name: Improved Armor Focus
improved-armor-focus.hint: The 'Improved' adjective, feat names are checked for this plus 'Armor Focus'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

martial-focus.name: Martial Focus
martial-focus.hint: The name of the 'Martial Focus' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

mythicElementalFocus.name: Mythic Elemental Focus
mythicElementalFocus.hint: The 'Mythic' adjective, feat names are checked for this plus 'Elemental Focus'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

mythicSpellFocus.name: Mythic Spell Focus
mythicSpellFocus.hint: The 'Mythic' adjective, feat names are checked for this plus 'Spell Focus'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

mythic-weapon-focus.name: Mythic Weapon Focus
mythic-weapon-focus.hint: The 'Mythic' adjective, feat names are checked for this plus 'Weapon Focus'. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

racial-weapon-focus.name: Racial Weapon Focus
racial-weapon-focus.hint: The name of your 'Racial Spell Focus' feat. Only 'Gnome Weapon Focus' officially exists, but this allows for other racial variations. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

racial-weapon-focus-default-race.name: Racial Weapon Focus (default race)
racial-weapon-focus-default-race.hint: The default race to look for. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

should-auto-target-tokens.name: Automatically Target Tokens
should-auto-target-tokens.hint: When set to true and using the generic "Token Target", when the ability is enabled, the dialog will be skipped if you have tokens currently targeted and will automatically target those tokens. By default (false), the token target dialog opens with your currently targeted tokens pre-selected and you must verify those are the targets you actually want.

spellFocus.name: Spell Focus
spellFocus.hint: The name of the 'Spell Focus' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

spell-specialization.name: Spell Specialization
spell-specialization.hint: The name of the 'Spell Specialization' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

versatile-performance.name: Versatile Performance
versatile-performance.hint: The name of the 'Versatile Performance' bard ability. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

weapon-focus.name: Weapon Focus
weapon-focus.hint: The name of the 'Weapon Focus' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

weapon-finesse.name: Weapon Finesse
weapon-finesse.hint: The name of the 'Weapon Finesse' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

weapon-specialization.name: Weapon Specialization
weapon-specialization.hint: The name of the 'Weapon Specialization' feat. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.
